author: Abdinur
title: African launchpad
description: Africa has a high number of university graduates each year but lacks a pathway for those graduates to enter employment or start a business.

assessments.note: The outline addresses the challenge, however there is little in the way of details
Catalyst already works as a lunchpad so why wouldn't  the graduates apply directly on catalyst? So maybe creating guides on how to apply directly in Catalyst would be better to scale propperly.

There is merit in the challenge and also on the solution presented. Finding employment is always a very difficult aspect after graduation and with Cardano's focus on Africa, particularly in Ethiopia, this is proposal if a good match.

The proposal fails to explain its exact purpose. African university graduates are going to get help kickstarting businesses and are getting some cardano related courses, okay. This could build up to something with potential, but so far it lacks any definition and concreteness. You should have a detailed concept of what is going to happen with the money before applying for such an amount of funds.

Yes, this proposal addresses the challenge, and the community can benefit from the launch of this proposal. Still, at this current stage, this proposal needs a more developmental description and a straightforward plan.

Draft proposal. The problem and the solution are within the scope of the challenge, but there are no plans, metrics or goals to indicate the impact of the proposal on this challenge.

A practical plan is needed indicating how the proposal will address the challenge

I don't know what this is... you problem is that African graduates have a hard time finding employment. I don't understand how a launchpad that is going to kickstart ideas will necessarily help with the graduation problem... You need explain how this is going to happen. You have no information on how the launchpad is going to work...
There are no details on the plan thus it is unlikely to be successfully implemented.
Unfortunately there is almost no information about the proposer, his experience and no budget as well.

The proposal is lacking in details in terms of verifiable credentials or past experiences to provide any level of confidence that this plan can be executed. It needs to elaborate on what is a 'Launchpad' and how can it be filled with participants and what activities will they perform to improve job prospects and specifically what they can do within the Cardano ecosystem. This is a proposal which is in a very early stage. It will benefit from a more carefully presented document which lists each step to be undertaken, how much it will cost and the resources that is required to achieve its goals. The timelines and milestones will also need to be listed carefully to ensure audibility of each stage of the process.
There is no plan presented. The proposer says nothing about his qualifications. I was not able to find out what kind of organisation secure foothold is.

There is a massive potential for Cardano in Africa, but this proposal needs further development in terms of feasibility. This proposal lack details on proposer experience, team skills, and sensible details plan and budget implementation. I recommend reviewing your proposal by adding more detail on your experience, team skills, and how you plan to make this project a success.

Draft proposal. There is no plan, so there is no way to understand the relevance of the proposer's experience.

Anyway, I recommend that the proposal be detailed, as well as the profile of the proposer, citing experiences and qualifications that indicate the aptitude to execute the proposal successfully.

I don't understand how your experience, "I have experience of the African system and the difficulties faced by graduates who want to start a business in Africa" is going to enable you to build a business (or work?) launchpad. It's one thing to understand the problem but that doesn't mean you are able to fix it. You need expand on exactly how you are going to fix it and what QUALIFICATIONS you have to make this work...
There is no detail in this plan thus its feasibility cannot be effectively assessed.
This proposal is really short. It would help if we have more informations like a roadmap, a clear budget and maybe some introduction of the team behind the proposal.

There is not enough information in this proposal to consider. A challenge was stated, a solution was mentioned, however, the more difficult aspects of accomplishing the establishment of the launchpad Is severely lacking. This makes the requested $40000 very hard to tabulate in terms of project viability.
The proposal contains no information other than a very brief explanation of its purpose.

This proposal currently lacks milestones and KPI's.
Please develop a detailed roadmap of how you plan on implementing this project. Describe how you will manage the risk associated with your project. This proposal has potential if you add a lot of details to it.
Draft proposal. There are no metrics to audit the proposal. I recommend that the proposer follow the Catalyst documentation to prepare the proposal.

There is almost no information in this proposal except for a stated problem and a solution that does not completely address the problem as stated in the proposal. 

This proposal was also last updated almost a month ago... there should have been plenty of time to expand on how this solution was going to fix the problem but nothing has been done or expanded on. 

I suggest the author of this proposal re-think this idea and re-submit for the next available fund.

solution: Secure Foothold will deploy an African launchpad on the Cardano blockchain, the launchpad will kickstart a business idea for Africans
experience: I have experience of the African system and the difficulties faced by graduates who want to start a business in Africa.
